title: ftpmirror.gnu.org problem
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

try to install anything with `url= "https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/..."`

```console
==> Installing readline
==> Searching for binary cache of readline
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for readline found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/readline/readline-7.0.tar.gz
-=#=- #    #     #                                                                                                                 
curl: (60) SSL certificate problem: certificate has expired
More details here: https://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html

curl failed to verify the legitimacy of the server and therefore could not
establish a secure connection to it. To learn more about this situation and
how to fix it, please visit the web page mentioned above.
==> Fetching from https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/readline/readline-7.0.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for readline-7.0-tjd5dul25fk2ercddtz4ved5s5bzums3

/home/hron/pkg/DEV/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:961, in do_fetch:
        958                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
        959                                 self.spec.format('$_$@'), ck_msg)
        960
  >>    961        self.stage.create()
        962        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
        963        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
        964
```

changing url to `url= "https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/..."` or `url= "http://ftpmirror.gnu.org/..."` works ok
